dct_title_s: A new and Exact MAP of the DOMINIONS of the KING of GREAT BRITAIN on ye continent of NORTH AMERICA. Containing NEWFOUNDLAND, NEW SCOTLAND, NEW ENGLAND, NEW YORK, NEW JERSEY, PENSILVANIA MARYLAND, VIRGINIA and CAROLINA. According to the Newest and most Exact Observations
dct_description_sm: Issued in his: The world described; or a new and correct sett of maps ... [Map 8] / J. Bowles. -- [London, 1709-1720].

Map of area surrounding the St. Lawrence River. Dedication within coat-of-arms: To the Honorable WALTER DOWGLASS Esq. ... This Map is most Humbly Dedicated by your most Humble Servant Herman Moll Geogr. 1715. Inset: “A Map of the PRINCIPAL PART of NORTH AMERICA.” showing the lower part of California as an island, and labeled “California I.” Inset map dimensions: 10.8 x 11.6 cm. Additional insets: “A Map of ... CAROLINA”; “THE GULF OF MEXICO”; “CHARLESTOWN”; and a vignette of beavers and the Niagara Falls, included on various maps. Imprint at lower left, above the inset of the Gulf of Mexico. First printed in 1715. Reissued for nearly 25 years with minor revisions, and after his death by his successors.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
